basics.name: Juan David Ríos
basics.label: Engineer, entrepreneur, coder
basics.summary: Welcome to my home page. I am a passionate engineer with drive to solve problems in the world by means of engineering, science, entrepreneurship and coding. My range of exploration has gone from magnetic levitation systems, eolic energy generators, drones for aerial photography to robots for surveillance in closed spaces and medical assistance of the elderly, a smart water meter and a musical device to create music from motion and spatial gestures. This experiences have taught me what is needed to create models, physical devices and software by facilitating the convergence of disciplines such as mathematics, physical modeling, software, hardware and design. If you are interested in my work, please check my portfolio and blog sections.

education.institution: University of Florida, Gainesville, FL, USA

highlights: As a full stack developer I helped to develop a web app and cloud computing platform to monitor and schedule the working hours of personal in industries such as amusement parks, hospitals and cafeterias.
Designed and built a biometric system backend and control software based in fingerprint detection to monitor arrival/departure of employees from work.
I was part of the foundational team of an early stage startup located in the Cambridge Innovation Center.
Leaded the conception, design and development of a smart water meter and took the project from the prototype phase to manufacturing (pilot tests) in a period of time of about one and a half years.

As part of the Cambridge innovation center I was exposed and actively involved to Boston’s startup ecosystem, learning best practices and tools to thrive in an entrepreneurial and highly demanding environment.
Worked in the repair and analysis of defective cases using hardware and software tools to troubleshot the company's robotic systems
My line of work focused it two different humanoid robots: Pepper, an emotional robot used in retail and NAO, used in research, education and the treatment of autistic children.
I also traveled to Paris and Tokyo to support the deployment of the robots around the world.

work.summary: Early stage startup Cofounder and CTO
highlights: In Chime we built a musical device to create music from motion using embedded systems, sensors, artificial intelligence and music theory.
The original idea was conceived in an international Hackathon -Angelhack-  in Atlanta, Georgia where I and my team won the first prize.
Eventually I and my co-founder created a multidisciplinary group of four people to improve the prototype and demoed it in Silicon Valley.
Developed applications for the optimization and management of the company own-trucks and critical resources using python, C++ and visual basic
I also supported the direction staff in the decision taking process providing valuable business intelligence through research and data analytics.
